trans-unit.source: Event Hubs authentication and security model overview
trans-unit.target: Event Hubs authentication and security model overview

trans-unit.source: The Event Hubs security model meets the following requirements:
trans-unit.target: The Event Hubs security model meets the following requirements:

trans-unit.source: Only devices that present valid credentials can send data to an Event Hub.
trans-unit.target: Only devices that present valid credentials can send data to an Event Hub.

trans-unit.source: A device cannot impersonate another device.
trans-unit.target: A device cannot impersonate another device.

trans-unit.source: A rogue device can be blocked from sending data to an Event Hub.
trans-unit.target: A rogue device can be blocked from sending data to an Event Hub.

trans-unit.source: Device authentication
trans-unit.target: Device authentication

trans-unit.source: The Event Hubs security model is based on a combination of <link><linkText>Shared Access Signature (SAS)</linkText><title></title></link> tokens and event publishers.
trans-unit.target: The Event Hubs security model is based on a combination of <link><linkText>Shared Access Signature (SAS)</linkText><title></title></link> tokens and event publishers.

trans-unit.source: An event publisher defines a virtual endpoint for an Event Hub.
trans-unit.target: An event publisher defines a virtual endpoint for an Event Hub.

trans-unit.source: The publisher can only be used to send messages to an Event Hub.
trans-unit.target: The publisher can only be used to send messages to an Event Hub.

trans-unit.source: It is not possible to receive messages from a publisher.
trans-unit.target: It is not possible to receive messages from a publisher.

trans-unit.source: Typically, an Event Hub employs one publisher per device.
trans-unit.target: Typically, an Event Hub employs one publisher per device.

trans-unit.source: All messages that are sent to any of the publishers of an Event Hub are enqueued within that Event Hub.
trans-unit.target: All messages that are sent to any of the publishers of an Event Hub are enqueued within that Event Hub.

trans-unit.source: Publishers allow fine-grained access control and throttling.
trans-unit.target: Publishers allow fine-grained access control and throttling.

trans-unit.source: Each device is assigned a unique token, which is uploaded to the device.
trans-unit.target: Each device is assigned a unique token, which is uploaded to the device.

trans-unit.source: The tokens are produced such that each unique token grants access to a different unique publisher.
trans-unit.target: The tokens are produced such that each unique token grants access to a different unique publisher.

trans-unit.source: A device that possesses a token can only send to one publisher, but no other publisher.
trans-unit.target: A device that possesses a token can only send to one publisher, but no other publisher.

trans-unit.source: If multiple devices share the same token, then each of these devices shares a publisher.
trans-unit.target: If multiple devices share the same token, then each of these devices shares a publisher.

trans-unit.source: Although not recommended, it is possible to equip devices with tokens that grant direct access to an Event Hub.
trans-unit.target: Although not recommended, it is possible to equip devices with tokens that grant direct access to an Event Hub.

trans-unit.source: Any device that holds such a token can send messages directly into that Event Hub.
trans-unit.target: Any device that holds such a token can send messages directly into that Event Hub.

trans-unit.source: Such a device will not be subject to throttling.
trans-unit.target: Such a device will not be subject to throttling.

trans-unit.source: Furthermore, the device cannot be blacklisted from sending to that Event Hub.
trans-unit.target: Furthermore, the device cannot be blacklisted from sending to that Event Hub.

trans-unit.source: All tokens are signed with a SAS key.
trans-unit.target: All tokens are signed with a SAS key.

trans-unit.source: Typically, all tokens are signed with the same key.
trans-unit.target: Typically, all tokens are signed with the same key.

trans-unit.source: Devices are not aware of the key; this prevents devices from manufacturing tokens.
trans-unit.target: Devices are not aware of the key; this prevents devices from manufacturing tokens.

trans-unit.source: Creating the key
trans-unit.target: Creating the key

trans-unit.source: When creating a namespace, Service Bus generates a 256-bit SAS key named RootManageSharedAccessKey.
trans-unit.target: When creating a namespace, Service Bus generates a 256-bit SAS key named RootManageSharedAccessKey.

trans-unit.source: This key grants send, listen, and manage rights to the namespace.
trans-unit.target: This key grants send, listen, and manage rights to the namespace.

trans-unit.source: You can create additional keys.
trans-unit.target: You can create additional keys.

trans-unit.source: It is recommended that you produce a key that grants send permissions to the specific Event Hub.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended that you produce a key that grants send permissions to the specific Event Hub.

trans-unit.source: For the remainder of this topic, it is assumed that you named this key EventHubSendKey.
trans-unit.target: For the remainder of this topic, it is assumed that you named this key EventHubSendKey.

trans-unit.source: Generating tokens
trans-unit.target: Generating tokens

trans-unit.source: You can generate tokens using the SAS key.
trans-unit.target: You can generate tokens using the SAS key.

trans-unit.source: You must produce only one token per device.
trans-unit.target: You must produce only one token per device.

trans-unit.source: Typically, the tokens have a lifespan that resembles or exceeds the lifespan of the device.
trans-unit.target: Typically, the tokens have a lifespan that resembles or exceeds the lifespan of the device.

trans-unit.source: If the device has the capability to obtain a new token, tokens with a shorter lifespan can be used.

trans-unit.source: Devices sending data
trans-unit.target: Devices sending data

trans-unit.source: Once the tokens have been created, each device is provisioned with its own unique token.
trans-unit.target: Once the tokens have been created, each device is provisioned with its own unique token.

trans-unit.source: When the device sends data into an Event Hub, the device tags its token with the send request.
trans-unit.target: When the device sends data into an Event Hub, the device tags its token with the send request.

trans-unit.source: To prevent an attacker from eavesdropping and stealing the token, the communication between the device and the Event Hub must occur over an encrypted channel.
trans-unit.target: To prevent an attacker from eavesdropping and stealing the token, the communication between the device and the Event Hub must occur over an encrypted channel.

trans-unit.source: Blacklisting devices
trans-unit.target: Blacklisting devices

trans-unit.source: If a token is stolen by an attacker, the attacker can impersonate the device whose token has been stolen.
trans-unit.target: If a token is stolen by an attacker, the attacker can impersonate the device whose token has been stolen.

trans-unit.source: Blacklisting a device renders the device unusable until the device is given a new token that uses a different publisher.
trans-unit.target: Blacklisting a device renders the device unusable until the device is given a new token that uses a different publisher.

trans-unit.source: Authentication of backend applications
trans-unit.target: Authentication of backend applications

trans-unit.source: To authenticate backend applications that consume the data generated by devices, Event Hubs employs a security model that is similar to the model that is used for Service Bus topics.
trans-unit.target: To authenticate backend applications that consume the data generated by devices, Event Hubs employs a security model that is similar to the model that is used for Service Bus topics.

trans-unit.source: An Event Hubs consumer group is equivalent to a subscription to a Service Bus topic.
trans-unit.target: An Event Hubs consumer group is equivalent to a subscription to a Service Bus topic.

trans-unit.source: A client can create a consumer group if the request to create the consumer group is accompanied by a token that grants manage privileges for the Event Hub, or for the namespace to which the Event Hub belongs.
trans-unit.target: A client can create a consumer group if the request to create the consumer group is accompanied by a token that grants manage privileges for the Event Hub, or for the namespace to which the Event Hub belongs.

trans-unit.source: A client is allowed to consume data from a consumer group if the receive request is accompanied by a token that grants receive rights on that consumer group, the Event Hub, or the namespace to which the Event Hub belongs.
trans-unit.target: A client is allowed to consume data from a consumer group if the receive request is accompanied by a token that grants receive rights on that consumer group, the Event Hub, or the namespace to which the Event Hub belongs.

trans-unit.source: The current version of Service Bus does not support SAS rules for individual subscriptions.
trans-unit.target: The current version of Service Bus does not support SAS rules for individual subscriptions.

trans-unit.source: The same holds true for Event Hubs consumer groups.
trans-unit.target: The same holds true for Event Hubs consumer groups.

trans-unit.source: SAS support will be added for both features in the future.
trans-unit.target: SAS support will be added for both features in the future.

trans-unit.source: In the absence of SAS authentication for individual consumer groups, you can use SAS keys to secure all consumer groups with a common key.
trans-unit.target: In the absence of SAS authentication for individual consumer groups, you can use SAS keys to secure all consumer groups with a common key.

trans-unit.source: This approach enables an application to consume data from any of the consumer groups of an Event Hub.
trans-unit.target: This approach enables an application to consume data from any of the consumer groups of an Event Hub.
